full_summary:
## Trap and Data Collection Services - Cobourg Brook
#### Tender Number: PW-22-01017787
#### Solicitation Number: 30003745

**Project Background**

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) has implemented a comprehensive program to control the sea lamprey population in the Great Lakes region. The program involves the installation of traps to capture and estimate the population of adult sea lampreys in each lake. One of the trap sites is located in the Cobourg Brook, which requires a contractor to operate the trap, collect data, and provide a mark-recapture study to estimate the population.

**Tender Description**

The successful contractor will be responsible for operating the trap on Cobourg Brook, conducting a weekly mark-recapture study, and collecting biological data from the captured sea lampreys. The contractor will also be required to complete a daily report and submit it to the DFO. The project duration will be between March 15 and August 1, 2023, with optional years following a similar schedule.

**Requirements and Deliverables**

The contractor must provide a vehicle capable of transporting lamprey in water (up to 225 kg) and have a minimum of two personnel on site to ensure the safety and efficiency of the operation. The contractor will be required to:

* Operate the trap on Cobourg Brook for a minimum of 12 consecutive weeks, with possible extensions up to 4 additional weeks.
* Conduct a weekly mark-recapture study and provide estimates of the sea lamprey population.
* Collect biological data from the captured sea lampreys, including length, weight, sex, maturity, and gut contents.
* Complete a daily report and submit it to the DFO.
* Maintain accurate records and ensure the well-being of the captured sea lampreys.

**Contractor Responsibilities**

The contractor is responsible for all costs associated with the project, including the disposal of sea lampreys, insurance requirements, transportation, and communication with the DFO. The contractor must also ensure that all personnel on site are aware of the task hazard analysis and follow the adult assessment trapping protocol.

**Departmental Responsibilities**

The DFO will provide the necessary equipment, storage, and data forms to the contractor. The department will also ensure that the contractor is aware of any hazards associated with the project.

**Evaluation and Selection Criteria**

The contract will be awarded based on the contractor's technical and financial qualifications, as well as their ability to meet the project requirements. A written proposal will be required from interested contractors, and evaluation
